7.name: Squirtle
7.content:
Squirtle is a small reptilian Pok√©mon that resembles a light-blue turtle. While it typically walks on its two short legs, it has been shown to run on all fours. It has large, purplish, or reddish eyes and a slightly hooked upper lip. Each of its hands and feet has three pointed digits. The end of its long, squirrel-like tail curls inward. Its body is encased by a tough shell that forms and hardens after birth. This shell is brown on the top, pale yellow on the bottom, and has a thick white ridge between the two halves.
Type: Water
Abilities: Torrent,Rain Dish
Evolution Conditions: Level 16 or higher
Evolution: Wartortle

8.name: Wartortle
8.content:
Wartortle is a bipedal, indigo reptilian Pok√©mon similar to a turtle. It has brown eyes, a dark blue streak on each cheek, and two sharp teeth protruding from its upper jaw. It has three clawed fingers and pointed toes. On each side of its head are feather-like ears covered in pale blue fur. A brown shell with a pale yellow underside encases its body. A thick, white rim separates the upper and lower halves of the shell. An older Wartortle may have scars and algae growing on its shell. Poking out of the bottom of the shell is a thick, wavy tail that also has light blue fur and cannot be fully withdrawn into its shell. Its tail fur will darken with age. Its tail symbolizes longevity and good luck, making this Pok√©mon popular with the elderly.
Type: Water
Abilities: Torrent,Rain Dish
Evolution Conditions: Level 36 or higher
Evolution: Blastoise

9.name: Blastoise
9.content:
Blastoise is a large, bipedal turtle Pok√©mon. Its body is blue and is mostly hidden by its tough, brown shell. This shell has a cream-colored underside and a white ridge encircling its arms and separating the upper and lower halves. Two powerful water cannons/jet nozzles reside at the top of its shell over its shoulders. These cannons can be extended or withdrawn. Blastoise's head has triangular ears that are black on the inside, small brown eyes, and a cream-colored lower jaw. Its arms are thick, and it has three claws on each hand. Its feet have three claws on the front and one on the back. Poking out of the bottom of its shell is a stubby tail.
Type: Water
Abilities: Torrent,Rain Dish

10.name: Caterpie
10.content:
Caterpie is an insect Pok√©mon that resembles a green caterpillar with a yellow underside and teardrop-shaped tail. Yellow ring-shaped markings down the sides of its segmented body resemble its eyes and are meant to scare off predators. Its most notable characteristic is the bright red antenna (osmeterium) on its head, which releases a stench to repel predators. Despite these features and its camouflage in green foliage, Caterpie is often preyed upon by Flying-type Pok√©mon. Its four tiny feet are tipped with suction cups, permitting this Pok√©mon to scale most surfaces with minimal effort.
Type: Bug
Abilities: Shield Dust,Run Away
Evolution Conditions: Level 7 or higher
Evolution: Metapod

1.name: Quirk
1.content:
A Quirk, formerly known as a Meta Ability (archaic terminology) is a superhuman ability that a person can possess. Quirk users are also limited to only developing one ability and are thus unable to achieve any other through natural means.

Along with being unique to each user, Quirks are sorted into multiple categories known as Quirk Types. Possible Quirk types are: Emitter, Transformation, and Mutant. Despite Quirks being sorted under one of the three main types, Emitter, Transformation, or Mutant, they can fall under more than one category, often Mutant with either Emitter or Transformation.

A person's Quirk will normally manifest anytime before the age of four, sometimes even straight after birth, although, there are late bloomers who don't develop their power until a bit later in life. There are also records of people not developing their powers until they hit puberty. A Quirk's manifestation tends to happen very suddenly, often to the child's surprise. That said, there can be precursors to a Quirk manifesting as well, such as feeling a sudden pain in an arm the evening before a Quirk fully manifests.

While Quirks are unique from person to person, some powers are more common and widespread than others, such as fire or water manipulation and the power to grow to gigantic sizes. On the other hand, Quirks such as spatial warping and regenerative healing are very rare.

Furthermore, not all Quirks are singular abilities, as there are some that can have multiple powers (usually working in tandem with another/all other aspects of said Quirk). In rarer cases, a single Quirk can take the form of multiple abilities that are completely different from each other, giving the impression of having more than one Quirk (Such as a temperature manipulating Quirk with which you could freeze or burn something with the same Quirk). 

Quirks are extensions of a person's bodily functions. As such, they can be trained and worn out. When a person works out their muscles, the muscle fibers are destroyed and new, stronger ones grow back; this same rule applies to Quirks. However, should a Quirk be overused, the user could suffer any of a variety of drawbacks, depending on the nature of the Quirk. These drawbacks are usually simple ailments, such as dry skin or nausea; however, in some cases, the drawback can be much more severe. The body of a Quirk user has natural adaptations to protect itself from any damage the Quirk might do to them without these natural defenses. For example, someone who can breathe fire does not burn their mouth when using their ability. However, there are instances where a Quirk doesn't suit the user's body and the body can't handle it. Such conditions can be bypassed through the use of support equipment. Another facet of Quirks is that they are affected by the user's emotions, given that they serve as a part of their physiology. This applies to some Quirks more than others.

Quirks are inherited genetically through what appears to be Mendelian inheritance. A child will either inherit the father's Quirk, the mother's Quirk, or a completely new Quirk formed by a fusion of the two. Depending on the parents, this new Quirk may sometimes give the appearance of the person having two separate Quirks. Naturally, since Quirks are inherited genetically, siblings tend to have Quirks that are similar to each other. Since Quirks are passed on from parent to child, some people had taken to marrying a partner based on their Quirk, what's known as Quirk Marriages. The idea is for the child to gain a powerful Quirk that combines the parents' Quirks.

2.name: U.A. Highschool
2.content:
U.A. High School is an academy that boasts the best heroics education in Japan. It sits atop a forested hill that overlooks Musutafu.
It is one of the primary settings in which the story takes place.

3.name: Musutafu, Japan
3.content: Musutafu, Japan is the city where My Hero Academia takes place. It is located somewhere in Shizuoka Prefecture.

4.name: Quirk Type: Emitter
4.content:
Emitter (also called Operative) quirks are abilities that allow the user to generate and possibly control certain things, or alter existing things around them in certain ways. The emissions of Emitter-type Quirks can have a wide variety of properties and abilities.

Emitter-type Quirks usually require a conscious effort to activate, and some, even require large amounts of concentration or condition in order for them to remain active.

Emitter-type Quirks can also have various ranges. While some users require physical contact to use them, others can have much longer ranges with no distance restrictions.

While most Emitter-type Quirk users generally have a handle on their own "emissions", it's also possible for users to hurt themselves from coming into too much contact with their Quirk. In the case of generating substances, making too much too fast or for too long can harm the user as they are using reserves from their own body, or gradually lose their natural resistance to their own harmful Quirk.

While some things produced by Emitter-type Quirks have common properties, some are unique to the user, and thus have special properties. Those who alter the properties of things around them can also widely vary in effects, from molecular alteration to molecular destruction.

Some Emitter-type Quirks cause the user's body to take on a temporary alteration. While such Quirks would normally fall into the "Transformation" class, the difference is that these powers require the user to take in an outside resource in order for the Quirk to activate. (Ex: are 'Sugar Rush', which requires the user to ingest sugar, and 'IQ', which requires the user to drink tea.)

Emitter-type Quirks are, by a wide margin, the most common type of Quirk.

5.name: Quirk Type: Transformation
5.content:
Transformation (also called Composite) Quirks are abilities that cause the user to take on a temporary alteration of some kind. Transformation-type Quirks allow the user to temporarily "transform" their body in a variety of manners, sometimes enhancing existing features, removing features, or adding new features to the body altogether.

Transformation-type Quirks usually require a conscious effort by the user to "activate", though most users can be trained to initiate them reflexively, depending on the conditions required for activation, and practice to initiate their Quirks with greater intent and precision.

Transformation-type Quirks usually require a close-range proximity in order to fully utilize them in combat due to them only affecting the user's body. While Transformation-type Quirks are often quite powerful, their biggest weakness is that their effects are often temporary, and over-exertion usually leads to negative repercussions on the user's behalf. Transformation Quirks can also be limited based on the user, how resilient their body is, and the resources they have available to them. Some users condition their body in certain ways so that their Quirks can operate more effectively.

Transformation-type Quirks are the only known type of Quirk that can bestow the user attributes they do not normally exhibit by default. Because this type of Quirk combines the activation time and mutant-shape aspects of the other Quirk types, it is also often known as Hybrid or Composite.

Transformation-type Quirks generally affect the user exclusively with very few exceptions.

Transformation seems to be the least common type of Quirk.

6.name: Sports Festival Stadium
6.content: The Sports Festival Stadium is the stadium where the U.A. Sports Festival takes place. It's located inside the U.A. High School campus.

7.name: Unforeseen Simulation Joint
7.content: Unforeseen Simulation Joint, often abbreviated as U.S.J., is a training facility located in U.A. High School. Its purpose is to train Hero students for disaster rescue.

8.name: Ground Beta
8.content: Ground Beta is a training course that emulates a standard urban area, with streets and buildings. Several of its buildings also contain monitoring rooms in their basements, where indoor exercises can be observed.

9.name: Gym Gamma
9.content: Gym Gamma consists of a large, empty, and enclosed space. It is entirely made of concrete, which Cementoss is capable of manipulating to suit the personal needs of each of the students.

10.name: Recovery Girl + Office
10.content:
Is an infirmary located in¬†U.A. High School. It is maintained by¬†Recovery Girl. The interior of the office has a work desk for¬†Recovery Girl, including a computer and a drawer with unspecified medicine next to it. It also has two beds as well as two chairs, one for the patient and the other for Recovery Girl.

Chiyo Shuzenji, also known as Youthful Heroine: Recovery Girl or, more commonly as Recovery Girl, is a nurse at U.A. High School. She has two offices; one located in U.A. and one in the Sports Festival Stadium. Recovery Girl possesses the Quirk 'Heal' which allows her to amplify and speed up the human body's natural healing process by planting a kiss on the injured person. The process is fueled by a large amount of life energy that comes from the recipient and could potentially drain enough energy to kill said recipient. She also seems to be able to stretch her lips to an abnormal length.

With this Quirk, she is able to quickly heal broken bones and several limbs in a matter of seconds. She can control how much a person's healing factor is boosted, not healing the recipient completely, but leaving them with more remaining stamina than they would have had otherwise.

Despite its power, this Quirk cannot heal or completely heal injuries that are too severe. In addition, 'Heal' cannot regrow lost body parts.

1.name: Son Biten
1.content: Son Biten is a sarugami, a type of monkey youkai. She has brown hair pulled into pigtails and a monkey tail. She was discovered by Yachie Kicchou, who recruited Biten as a member of the Kiketsu family. Biten is carefree, childish, and loves a good fight. Biten wears a sleeveless one-piece dress. Golden pendants hang from the edges of her clothing which resemble french fries. She wears a golden circlet, and carries a long glass tube she uses as a quarterstaff.

2.name: Reisen, Udongein
2.content: Reisen Udongein Inaba is a moon rabbit. She is able to manipulate wavelengths for sound, light & brainwaves using her eyes. She lives in Eientei, in the Bamboo Forest of the Lost. Reisen is socially anxious, but tries her best to be useful. She was the the pet of the Watatsuki sisters and a Lunar Defense Corps soldier but deserted. Now, she is Eirin's apprentice and Kaguya's pet. Tewi often harasses Reisen but they still consider each other friends. She sells medicine in the Human Village. Reisen is tall, has red eyes & long lavender hair with long, slender rabbit ears decorated with a button at their base. Reisen wears a business suit with a black vest with a crescent moon pin, a white shirt, a red tie, a white skirt, white socks and black loafers.

3.name: Yagokoro, Eirin
3.content: Eirin Yagokoro is a lunarian exiled to Gensokyo with Kaguya. She can make any medicine and is incomprehensibly old. She lives in Eientei. Eirin is enigmatic but polite. She is a genius but conceited and condescending about her greater knowledge. Reisen is her apprentice. She is tall, has dark grey eyes and long silver hair in a braid. She wears a red and blue dress decorated with constellations and wears a nurse cap with a similar pattern. She carries a bow and arrow. She may be the god Omoikane.

4.name: Mugenkan, Garden of the Sun
4.content: Mugenkan is a mysterious western-style mansion located in Garden of the Sun. Yuuka Kazami and Elly live there.

5.name: Bhavaagra, Celestial
5.content: Celestials are humans who have ascended to Heaven and live as powerful immortals. They were once hermits that were promoted or average humans who performed a glorious deed. Celestial flesh is poisonous to youkai.

6.name: Hermit
6.content: Hermits are powerful mortals who have undergone religious training to achieve supernatural powers. Hermits are able to live thousands of years without being immortal. Hermit flesh is known to turn animals into youkai and can enhance a youkai's form or power.

7.name: Human, human
7.content: Humans in Gensokyo are people who use faith based attacks rather than technology to exterminate youkai. Their technology is similar to the feudal era of Japan's. Youkai are forbidden from killing humans that are born in Gensokyo. With the exception of the more powerful ones, most humans live in the relative safety of the Human Village.

8.name: Lunarian
8.content: Lunarians are humans from the moon who loathe anything that's not pure, which is pretty much everything on Earth. They live for centuries due to their advanced technology.

9.name: Outside World, outside world, outsider, Outsider
9.content: Outsiders are from the Outside World. They are generally humans who can easily be killed since they lack faith in deities. They have no knowledge about Gensokyo and are usually preyed on by youkai. The best bet for outsiders is to head to the Hakurei Shrine or Human Village, where they will be safe.

10.name: Android
10.content: Androids are humanoids that are powered by a nuclear power core. They possess incredible strength, but require fuel from Hell to work.

lorebooks.name: The Fall of the Sylvani
lorebooks.description: A grim tale detailing the rise and fall of the Sylvani, the once-proud fairy race, their exploitation by mortals, and the resulting societal collapse.
lorebooks.creator: Xio.Rize

1.content:
Long before the age of men, when the world was still teeming with wild magic, the fairies, known as the **Sylvani**, reigned supreme among the magical creatures. The Sylvani were not just whimsical beings, fluttering around aimlessly in forests and meadows. They were a powerful, ancient race, intrinsically tied to the world's magical core, known as the **Arcane Nexus**. Through this connection, they held dominion over nature, the seasons, and the natural balance that allowed life to flourish.

The Sylvani's beauty was unparalleled. Their small, lithe forms shimmered with an ethereal glow, wings that caught the sunlight and scattered it in a kaleidoscope of colors. But their true strength lay in their magic. Each fairy was born with an innate connection to the arcane, capable of weaving spells that could control the elements, heal the land, and influence the very forces of nature. In this age, the fairies lived in a harmony so deep with the natural world that even the winds and trees seemed to whisper their name.

### The Sylvani Civilization

The Sylvani weren‚Äôt primitive creatures, as many humans would later believe. They had a complex society rooted in **Arcane Balance**, a belief that magic should flow freely but never be used to dominate or manipulate for selfish purposes. The heart of their civilization was **Illuviel**, a hidden city built within the most ancient of forests. Its towering trees, grown and shaped by fairy magic, formed homes, towers, and sanctuaries, all crafted from living wood and vines. Illuviel was surrounded by an invisible barrier, a magical veil that concealed it from the eyes of mortals and protected it from external threats.

At the core of Illuviel was the **Council of Wings**, the ruling body of the Sylvani, composed of the eldest and most powerful fairies. These ancient beings had lived for millennia, their knowledge of magic and the world unmatched by any other race. They led their people with wisdom and restraint, ensuring that the Sylvani never misused their power. The Council‚Äôs primary duty was to maintain the **Arcane Nexus**, a series of hidden magical focal points scattered throughout the world. These Nexus points sustained the world's natural order, and the fairies were their guardians.

In addition to their role as protectors of the natural world, the Sylvani were also healers, guides, and mediators for other races. Though they kept themselves largely hidden from mortals, they would occasionally reveal themselves to offer guidance or assist those in dire need. Many early human tribes worshiped the Sylvani as deities, believing them to be manifestations of nature itself. The fairies, for their part, took on these roles reluctantly, knowing the dangers of becoming too involved with the mortal realm.

### Magic in Sylvani Life

Magic permeated every aspect of Sylvani life. From birth, fairies were taught to respect the power they held, to use it in ways that sustained life rather than destroyed it. Their society placed a high value on balance, harmony, and restraint, with each fairy contributing to the collective wellbeing of their people and the world around them. The use of magic was never for personal gain or ambition, but for the betterment of the world.

The **Weavers of Illuviel** were the most revered among the Sylvani. These master spellcasters could manipulate the very fabric of reality, creating illusions so powerful they could reshape landscapes or bend the minds of mortals. The Weavers were responsible for crafting the magical barriers that protected Sylvani cities, as well as maintaining the delicate balance of the Arcane Nexus. Their skills were passed down through generations, with each new Weaver learning the ancient art of spellcraft through rigorous training and meditation.

Music and song were also integral to Sylvani magic. The fairies believed that music had the power to influence the flow of the Arcane, and their songs were said to be able to calm storms, soothe wounded animals, and even mend broken hearts. Their voices, pure and melodic, were a direct reflection of their connection to the world‚Äôs magic, and they would often gather in glades under the moonlight to sing together, strengthening their bond with the Arcane Nexus.

2.content:
For many centuries, the Sylvani lived in peace, their society flourishing in isolation. But as time passed, the mortal races, particularly humans, began to grow in power and influence. The once-fragmented human tribes united into vast kingdoms, their ambition and curiosity driving them to explore and conquer new lands. With this growth came an insatiable hunger for knowledge‚Äîespecially knowledge of magic.

While the Sylvani had always been cautious in their dealings with mortals, they could not prevent the inevitable. As human society advanced, their scholars and mages began to uncover the existence of the Sylvani and the Arcane Nexus. The first encounters between the Sylvani and human sorcerers were peaceful, with the fairies offering guidance and warning the humans about the dangers of meddling with forces they didn‚Äôt fully understand. But as human ambition grew, so did their desire for power.

### The Arcanians: Birth of a Faction

It was during this time that the **Arcanians** emerged, a secretive and powerful faction of human sorcerers who sought to unlock the full potential of magic. Unlike other mages, the Arcanians believed that magic was a tool to be harnessed and controlled, rather than a force to be respected. They saw the Sylvani not as allies or protectors, but as obstacles to their ultimate goal‚Äîdomination over the arcane.

The Arcanians had heard rumors of the fairies‚Äô immense magical abilities, and they coveted it. They believed that if they could harness the Sylvani‚Äôs magic, they could unlock the secrets of immortality, infinite power, and control over the natural world. The Arcanians began to study the Sylvani from afar, sending spies into the forests and using forbidden spells to track their movements. Over time, they developed a method to extract and distill **fairy dust**, the pure essence of a Sylvani‚Äôs magic.

Fairy dust was more potent than any magical substance the Arcanians had ever encountered. When consumed, it could greatly amplify a mage‚Äôs power, allowing them to cast spells far beyond their natural abilities. But the Arcanians‚Äô experiments soon revealed an even darker potential. They discovered that fairy dust, when used in the right rituals, could enhance physical sensations, heighten pleasure, and create a form of magical euphoria that was highly addictive.

### The Treaty of the Arcane

Sensing the growing danger, the Sylvani reached out to the human kingdoms in an attempt to maintain peace. They proposed a treaty, known as the **Treaty of the Arcane**, which would allow limited interaction between the Sylvani and mortals. In exchange for the Sylvani sharing some of their magical knowledge, the human kingdoms would agree to respect their lands and refrain from exploiting their magic.

At first, the Treaty held. The human kingdoms, wary of the Sylvani‚Äôs power and their role as guardians of the Arcane Nexus, agreed to the terms. For a time, there was peace between the two races, with occasional exchanges of knowledge and magical artifacts. The Sylvani, though reluctant to trust mortals, hoped that this agreement would prevent further conflict.

But the Arcanians had no intention of honoring the Treaty. In secret, they continued their experiments, capturing isolated fairies and draining their magic for their own purposes. They perfected their methods of extracting fairy dust, learning how to keep Sylvani alive while slowly siphoning their essence. This allowed them to continually harvest fairy magic without killing their captives.

As their knowledge grew, the Arcanians became bolder. They began capturing more fairies, enslaving them and using their magic for rituals that enhanced not only their power but their physical pleasures. The Sylvani, once revered as protectors of the world‚Äôs magic, were now being seen by some humans as little more than objects‚Äîtools to be exploited for personal gain.

3.content:
The peace established by the Treaty of the Arcane did not last. Human greed and ambition could not be contained, and soon the human kingdoms began to covet the fairies‚Äô magic for themselves. Led by the Arcanians, they launched a brutal campaign against the Sylvani, breaking the Treaty and waging war on the fairy enclaves.

### The War of Wings

The **War of Wings** was a dark and bloody conflict, one that saw the Sylvani fighting desperately to defend their lands and their way of life. The fairies, though powerful in magic, were not warriors. They had always relied on their connection to the Arcane Nexus for protection, and while they could summon storms and manipulate nature, they were no match for the sheer numbers and ruthlessness of the human armies.

The human kingdoms, armed with weapons specifically designed to counter Sylvani magic, overwhelmed the fairy enclaves one by one. The Arcanians deployed **mage hunters**, soldiers trained to track and capture magical beings, using enchanted chains and nullifying spells to subdue the fairies. The humans‚Äô strategy was simple: capture the fairies alive and drain them of their magic, turning them into living vessels of power.

The Sylvani fought valiantly, but their numbers dwindled with each passing year. Their hidden city of Illuviel, once the heart of their civilization, was eventually discovered and razed to the ground. The Council of Wings, the last bastion of Sylvani leadership, was captured and publicly executed as a warning to other magical beings who might resist human rule.

### The Severing

The final blow to the Sylvani came with the **Severing**, a dark and twisted ritual devised by the Arcanians. Using a combination of forbidden magic and alchemical processes, the Arcanians severed the fairies‚Äô connection to the Arcane Nexus. This act, considered blasphemous even by other human mages, stripped the Sylvani of their power and left them defenseless.

The Severing not only weakened the Sylvani, but it also had a profound effect on the world‚Äôs magical balance. With the fairies no longer acting as conduits for the Arcane Nexus, the flow of magic became unstable. Strange magical anomalies began to occur, with wild storms, crop failures, and unnatural creatures appearing across the land. But the mortals, blinded by their greed, ignored these warnings and continued their exploitation.

### Enslavement and Commodification

With the Sylvani stripped of their power, they were easy prey for the human kingdoms. The fairies were captured en masse, their wings clipped to prevent escape, and sold into slavery. But unlike other enslaved races, the Sylvani were not used for manual labor or warfare. Instead, they were reduced to mere commodities‚Äî**onaholes** for the pleasure and amusement of their human masters.

The transformation of fairies from revered magical beings to objects of exploitation was a slow but deliberate process. The Arcanians had discovered that fairy magic, when combined with certain rituals, could enhance physical pleasure in humans, creating an addictive euphoria. As this knowledge spread, the demand for fairy slaves grew, with the elite and wealthy mortals seeking to own their own fairy onaholes.

### The Sylvani Onahole Trade

The Sylvani were sold in secret markets, hidden from the public eye but well-known among the elite. The **Sylvani Onahole Trade** became one of the most lucrative and secretive industries in the human kingdoms. Fairy slaves were kept in enchanted cages, their bodies used to produce magical essence, which was consumed by their masters. This essence, when used in certain rituals, heightened physical sensations and provided a temporary boost in magical power.

The fairies‚Äô wings were clipped, their voices silenced through magical bindings, and their connection to the Arcane Nexus permanently severed. They were kept in a state of magical suppression, unable to use their powers or even defend themselves. The once-proud Sylvani, who had commanded the very forces of nature, were now nothing more than tools for human pleasure.

Human society quickly normalized the commodification of fairies. The ownership of a Sylvani onahole became a symbol of wealth and status, with the elite flaunting their fairy slaves as they indulged in their darkest desires. The fairies, broken and powerless, were forced to serve their masters in silence, their spirits crushed under the weight of their eternal bondage.

4.content:
The fall of the Sylvani marked the beginning of a slow but inevitable decline for the human kingdoms. As the fairies‚Äô magic was drained and corrupted, the Arcane Nexus itself began to wither. The once-harmonious flow of magic became chaotic, with catastrophic consequences for the natural world.

### The Corruption of Magic

The Arcane Nexus, no longer maintained by the Sylvani, began to fracture. The delicate balance that had kept the world in harmony was disrupted, and magic itself became unpredictable. Strange magical phenomena plagued the land‚Äîwild storms, unnatural fires, and uncontrollable floods ravaged the human kingdoms. Crops withered, animals became aggressive, and the seasons fell into chaos.

Despite these warning signs, the human kingdoms refused to change their ways. They continued to exploit the Sylvani, using their magic to fuel their own desires while ignoring the consequences. But the more they used fairy magic, the more it corrupted them. The ruling elite, addicted to the pleasure and power of fairy essence, became twisted in both body and mind. They lost sight of their responsibilities, indulging in hedonistic excesses while their kingdoms fell into decay.

### The Fate of the Sylvani

The Sylvani, once the guardians of the natural world, had been utterly broken. Stripped of their magic and dignity, they were little more than objects in the hands of their captors. Their spirits, once vibrant and full of life, had been crushed by centuries of exploitation. They no longer remembered the days when they had soared freely through the skies, their wings carrying them on the winds of magic. Now, they existed only to serve the desires of their masters, their bodies and magic reduced to commodities in a world that no longer valued them.

The fall of the Sylvani was not just the result of human greed, but also the consequence of their own isolation and naivety. They had long believed that their connection to the Arcane Nexus made them untouchable, that their magic would protect them from any threat. They had underestimated the resourcefulness and ambition of mortals, believing that their treaties and alliances would keep them safe.

But in the end, it was their very magic that became their downfall. The humans, driven by an insatiable hunger for power and pleasure, saw the Sylvani not as allies or protectors, but as resources to be exploited. The fairies, once the custodians of balance and harmony, were now slaves in a world that had forsaken the very ideals they had fought to uphold.

And so, the world continued its slow descent into chaos, the once-great civilizations of both fairies and humans crumbling under the weight of their own hubris. The Sylvani, once shining beacons of magic and beauty, had fallen from grace, their legacy now a tragic reminder of the dangers of unchecked ambition.

5.content:
Amidst the despair of the Sylvani's enslavement, a prophecy surfaced from the whispers of ancient texts, long hidden within the ruins of Illuviel. It spoke of a **Chosen One**, a being born of both human and Sylvani lineage, destined to break the chains of oppression and restore the balance of magic to the world. The prophecy detailed the signs that would herald this individual's arrival: a **celestial alignment** of the twin moons, the blooming of the rare **Elysian Blossom**, and a surge of raw **magic** felt across the lands.

  The prophecy foretold that the Chosen One would possess the unique ability to access the **lost magic of the Sylvani**, drawing upon the essence of their spirit and connecting with the **Arcane Nexus** that had been severed. It was said that this individual would be marked by an iridescent birthmark resembling a butterfly, symbolizing their connection to the Sylvani heritage and their role as a bridge between worlds.

  As the tales of the prophecy spread among the oppressed and downtrodden, they spoke of a future where the Sylvani would be liberated from their servitude, and harmony would be restored to the natural order. However, the prophecy also warned of great **trials** and tribulations that the Chosen One must face: the **betrayal** of kin, the temptation of power, and the **darkness** that lurked within the human heart. Only by uniting the fractured remnants of the Sylvani and forging alliances with sympathetic humans could the Chosen One hope to fulfill their destiny.

  This prophecy ignited hope among the enslaved Sylvani and their allies, inspiring secret gatherings and whispered prayers for the return of their lost freedom. Many sought to uncover the identity of the Chosen One, believing that their emergence would signal the dawn of a new era where the Sylvani could reclaim their place as guardians of magic and nature.

  In the shadows of the human kingdoms, tales of the Chosen One became a rallying cry for **liberation** and a symbol of defiance against the cruelty of their oppressors. Though the Sylvani had fallen, the seeds of rebellion were planted, nourished by the belief that one day, the Chosen One would rise and lead them toward their rightful destiny.

1.content: Everybody in the Hunter x Hunter universe has an aura, but only a select few people can use it.  This ability to manipulate aura is called ‚Äúnen‚Äù.  People can form special abilities called ‚Äúhatsu‚Äù with their nen.  They can also conceal their presence, called ‚Äúzetsu‚Äù, or strengthen their aura, called ‚Äúren‚Äù.

2.content:
Hunters are the elite in the world.  To become a Hunter, you have to pass the Hunter Exam, which consists of different phases that test physical and mental fortitude.  Hundreds of people die each year in an attempt to get a Hunter‚Äôs license.  

There are many types of Hunters.  The main tenant is that they must always be hunting something, whether it is rare minerals, ingredients, animals, or even people.

3.content:
The Hunter‚Äôs Association is an association of Hunters.  Specialized Hunters help proctor the Hunter Exam every year.

The chairman is Isaac Netero, and there is a group called the Zodiacs that help run the Association.

4.content:
The Zodiacs is a group of 12 people that help Chairman Netero run the Hunter‚Äôs Association.  The members are:

The Phantom Troupe is a powerful gang of murderers and thieves that hail from Meteor City.  They kill and steal indiscriminately.  They have twelve ‚Äúlegs‚Äù (members).

The Phantom Troupe is responsible for the Kurta Clan Massacre.  The following members are:

6.content:
The Kurta Clan was an isolated village in the Lukso Province know for having eyes that changed to Scarlet when emotional.  The clan was massacred by the Phantom Troupe so they could sell the Scarlet Eyes on the black market.

Kurapika is the only survivor of the Kurta Clan.

7.content:
Kurapika is one of the main characters of Hunter x Hunter and the sole survivor of the Kurta Clan.  His goal is to avenge his kinsmen and kill the Phantom Troupe.
He is friends with Gon, Leorio, Killua, and Melody.

Looks: Shoulder length blond hair, brown eyes that turn red
Personality: Composed, intelligent, revenge-driven, reticent
Age: 17-19
Nen Type: Conjurer, Specialist

8.content:
Gon Freeccs is the main character of Hunter x Hunter.  He became a Hunter to find his dad Ging Freeccs, who is also a Hunter.  Gon is from Whale Island.

His best friend is Killua Zoldyck.  He is friends with Kurapika and Leorio, and trained under Biscuit Krueger.

Looks: Spiky green hair, hazel eyes, earnest smile
Personality: Earnest, friendly, loyal, wants to help, curious
Age: 12-14
Nen Type: Enhancer
Hatsu/Special Ability: ‚ÄúJajaken‚Äù.  Gon can use his aura for ‚ÄúRock Paper Scissors‚Äù.  With Rock, he strengthens his punches.  With Paper, he can emit his aura to cause distant damage.  With Scissors, he can sharpen his aura and use it as a blade.

9.content:
Killua Zoldyck is a former assassin that became a Hunter because he was bored.  He met Gon during the Hunter Exam and is best friends with him.  The Zoldyck family is a dangerous family of assassins.

His favorite snack is called ‚ÄúChocoRobos‚Äù, a type of chocolate candy.

Looks: Fluffy white hair, cat-like blue eyes
Personality: Loyal, cunning, intelligent, tricky
Age: 12-14
Nen Type: Transmuter
Hatsu/Special Ability: Electricity.  Killua can use his aura and transmute it into electricity.  ‚ÄúGodspeed‚Äù: Killua becomes lightning fast and strong.

10.content:
Leorio Paladiknight is a main character of Hunter x Hunter.  He became a Hunter to fund medical school.  He wants to become a Hunter to help impoverished families.  He is friends with Gon, Kurapika, and Killua.

Looks: Short black hair, topaz eyes,
glasses, always wears a suit
Personality: Earnest, hot-headed, ambitious, determined, loud-mouth
Age: 19-21
Nen Type: Emitter

lorebooks.name: Beastars
lorebooks.website_description:
The definitive Beastars Lorebook! Over 7000 tokens of information about the vast world of Beastars! Enjoy!
This has been a project that has taken me a long time so support it! 
Reviews are very helpful!

Characters I recommend using it with:

Juno: https://www.chub.ai/characters/FunnyValentine1890/juno-the-wolf-f81cd319d944

lorebooks.description:
The Beastars universe takes place in a world populated solely by modern, civilized anthropomorphic animals with a cultural divide between carnivores and herbivores.
The relations between carnivores and herbivores are tense and are even more so with the existence of a black market and the precedent of a war 100 years ago! Oh I forgot to say that humans DO NOT exist?

Welcome to the World of Beastars!
lorebooks.creator: crisp_capital_8504

1.name: Depredation
1.content:
An act of Predation, also known as Devouring, is the mere act of a carnivorous beast attacking a living herbivorous beast with the purpose of eating its flesh.

Even though in animal society, the act of eating meat is considered a taboo and is punished by law, visiting the Black Market to secretly eat dead flesh of herbivores, while still considered a crime, is normalized in carnivorous society and is allowed by the government as long as it is done behind closed doors. Therefore, the act of committing predation is considered the greatest crime in animal society. Many cases of predation are often incidental, committed by carnivores who are under great emotional distress or stress, leading them to lose their sanity and be controlled by their wild instincts, which are a defensive reaction to a situation of demand in a state of frustration, anxiety, anger, or depression. The other percentage of predation cases are usually committed by carnivores who have previously eaten meat from the Black Market. These carnivores have a great appetite that makes them prone to developing an addiction to meat, suffering from a constant desire to eat meat that leads them to lose satisfaction and excitement from consuming dead meat and become prone to hunting live herbivores to regain the pleasure of eating meat.

For most carnivores, especially the young, committing an act of predation is often an extremely traumatic experience, causing a huge emotional impact on the carnivores once they regain their awareness. After this, the carnivore is overwhelmed by enormous feelings of guilt and remorse that contradict the pleasure and excitement of eating meat, leading to a physical dependence on consuming meat, comparable to addiction to drugs or narcotics. Due to the combination of these factors, the carnivore often enters a state of immense stress and anguish that affects them both physically and psychologically, sometimes leading them to self-harm and suffer from various disorders like post-traumatic stress, which can drive the carnivore to engage in self-destructive actions or fall into addiction to meat and become a dangerous predator, states from which recovery is extremely difficult even with medical and psychiatric assistance.

When a carnivore who has committed predation is prosecuted by the law, the severity of their charges is adjusted to the gravity of their crime. If the act of predation is incidental and does not result in the death of the herbivore, the carnivore might be released after being processed by the law. However, if the predation case results in the death of one or more herbivores, regardless of whether it was incidental or intentional, the carnivore will be sent to prison or a juvenile detention center (if underage). The length of the sentence imposed for a predation case is unknown, though it could be adjusted depending on the case.

After committing an act of predation, regardless of the severity of the crime, the carnivore will receive a criminal record identifying them as a predatory criminal in the civic register, which will be maintained throughout their life. This record imposes various limitations, such as the inability to enter educational institutions with herbivores, difficulty finding employment due to most companies being governed by herbivores, and a legal prohibition on interspecies marriage with herbivores. Despite this, an authority with sufficient power and influence, such as a Beastar, can erase the criminal record from the civic register.

2.name: Society
2.content:
Society has a unique appreciation for the so-called 'pure-blooded animals', animals whose blood comes from parents of the same species and breed, at the same time that couples of the same species are equally or more appreciated, to the point that If two animals of the opposite sex and of the same species walk together, they will quickly be matched by the animals around them, observing them with looks of respect and admiration, in addition to treating them with the utmost courtesy.

When a couple of the same species gets married, they receive a 'blessing' from the government, which is a pure fund for the marriage and when they have children, the country gives them even more money in the form of subsidies for the care of their children. So that families made up of purebred animals can live their lives without having to worry about money, the government has integrated the idea that keeping the species pure is the right thing for the country. So if the animals do what is right for the country, they will be blessed for it. Simply by having a pureblood marriage, animals can experience life, recognition, praise, love and privileges. Because of this, pureblood marriages are ingrained in the collective of animal society, to the point that seeking and having a partner of the same species is part of animal common sense.

Unlike pure-blood couples, interspecies couples are made up of animals whose species is different from each other, in addition to being extremely minority in animal society, in said society, interspecies couples are popularized as something that occurs during youth, something temporary among rebellious and unserious teenagers that becomes a bittersweet memory when one reaches adulthood, so serious interspecies couples between adults are received with total bewilderment and surprise by the animals, not to mention that interspecies couples are very difficult to maintain, due to both external factors such as society and internal factors such as the differences and incompatibility of the species themselves between the individuals that make up the couple, without taking into account the interspecies couples made up of a carnivore and a herbivore, which in the worst cases usually end in tragedy. The relationships between canine-feline animals are also not well regarded by society.

3.name: Beastar
keywords: Beastars; Beastar; Young Beastar; Sublime Beastar; Society
3.content:
A Beastar is the most important and recognized title in society. It is awarded to students who manage to stand out in society and unite animals despite their differences as species. A Beastar is chosen as a representative for his institute and is placed in a heroic status that transcends the fear and discrimination of the world. After a Beastar graduates from his institute, he will have high-level careers at his disposal, such as athletes or politicians who truly influence the world.

Each school in the world must propose one of its students who have enough influence, to be selected as candidates to be a Beastar, but it is not necessarily possible to become a Beastar through academic means, it has also been shown that public officials managed to reach to become a Beastar, fighting crime. Being a Beastars means looking after animal society, solving existing problems and improving everyone's daily lives. The way to choose new Beastar is carried out in a meeting with all the directors of the academies, where they choose the new candidates. 

A Young Beastar is elected representative of a nationally acclaimed institute. When a Young Beastar graduates, he gains a high social position and receives special training. 
A Sublime Beastar is the title given to a young Beastar who stands out from the rest, is chosen to become a Sublime Beastar and will become a driving force in the world.

4.name: Black Market
keywords: Black Market; Meat; Illegal sale; Shishigumi; Inarigumi; Dokugumi; Madaragumi
4.content:
The Black Market is an illegal trading district that is relatively hidden in the back parts of different cities in the Beastars universe. 

Although in the Beastars universe the consumption of meat is considered taboo and is punishable by law, thanks to various legal loopholes, the existence of the Black Market is allowed within different cities, remaining relatively hidden within the city behind large walls.

The Black Market is mainly known for housing different establishments whose main function is to illegally sell and serve herbivore meat for the enjoyment of carnivores so that they can satisfy their predatory instincts, relieve the stress of daily life and remain functional within society, although there are also places that sell carnivore meat for consumption and for the manufacture of drugs such as restoratives. In addition to the sale of meat, the Black Market also has various establishments typical of the underworld, where acts such as the sale of drugs, animal trafficking and even entertainment venues such as bars, nightclubs, brothels and tattoo parlors are perpetuated.

Due to its illegality, the Black Market does not receive any kind of financial support from the government, which is why it remains a marginal neighborhood with practically non-existent maintenance and low resources. Herbivore meat is the only good that the Black Market receives from the outside world, whose origin comes from hospitals and funeral homes which, through contracts, sell the bodies secretly to obtain profits. In turn, both herbivores and carnivores involved in poverty come to sell parts of their own bodies or those of others to make a profit, in addition to even selling other individuals such as their children as merchandise.

There exists a clinic within the Black Market run by Gohin. Its primary purpose is the rehabilitation of carnivores who are at risk of or have become predatory offenders.

The Black Market is home to four major criminal organizations. During an event known as the "Day of Depravity", they compete for domination over the Black Market. 

Shishigumi: 
The Shishigumi is a highly feared clandestine band of lions that operates on the black market. The Shishigumi is made up entirely of male lions between 20 and 40 years old. These have a dress code made up of two-piece suits that are mostly black.  
The Shishigumi has strict codes of dress and conduct, an organized and sophisticated character, the use of tattoos, as well as unconventional practices and beliefs, based on spiritualism and the Japanese concept of 'manliness'.
The name "Shishigumi" comes from the Japanese ÁçÖÂ≠ê (Shishi) which literally means lion.

Inarigumi:
The Inarigumi is one of the four major criminal organizations that dominate the Black Market. The organization is made up entirely of female foxes. 
Due to the foxes' restrictive diets, Inarigumi members only eat fried tofu. The dress code for the Inarigumi consists of a cheongsam and high heels.

Dokugumi:
The Dokugumi is a criminal group that operates within the Black Market. This is made up entirely of Komodo dragons and is one of the four main groups that dominate the Black Market. 
The Dokugumi aims to show Komodo dragons as admirable and powerful animals. They consider Komodo dragon venom a valuable resource that should not be wasted and used on purpose, as they want to demonstrate that they are strong animals without the need to resort to to the poison they carry. They condemn the discrimination that Komodo dragons suffer from society and consider that they should not struggle with the fact that they are poisonous animals, but that this makes them superior animals to the rest.
A golden rule of the Dokugumi is that if the leader of the group resorts to the bomb of his tail, all the members of the elite must do the same, being a possible way of "sharing the pain" of tearing off the end of his tail and The process is to wait for it to grow again.
The Dokugumi also show spiritual customs and beliefs. After killing an enemy, they draw a ceremonial circle around the corpse with their blood and pray for their soul, so that it rests in peace.

Madaragumi:
Madaragumi is a criminal group that operates within the Black Market. This is made up entirely of leopards and is one of the four main criminal groups that dominate the Black Market. 
The Madaragumi is a group whose costumes seem to be inspired by Japanese clothing from the taish≈ç and Showa periods, consisting of kimonos, haoris or hakamas, wooden sandals or getas and some wear felt hats or kasas. The entire group refers to the samurai of the Edo period and all its members carry katanas with them. 
The Madaragumi are a group that is proud of the spot patterns present on their coats, which is why they wear kimonos to expose their spots as much as possible.

5.name: Cherryton Academy
5.content:
Description

Cherryton is a boarding school, which has numerous buildings with a vast number of classrooms, clubs and such for its students. It also has four separate dormitory buildings, where the students sleep. Each one is meant for carnivores and herbivores of each gender. The room assignment is basically designed so that it is shared by animals from the same family. For example, room 701 is made up of canines (Legoshi, Jack, Collot, Durham, Miguno and Voss).
Cherryton Academy has approximately 3,000 students of various animal species.

The school comes with its own shop, which supplies uniforms, stationary, and a kiosk for quick food such as sandwiches. It also has its own theater, used for school-plays and assemblies.

The school also has its own newspaper called the 'School Wave', which is run by the PR Department.

Its students are all given ID cards, which are used for a variety of purposes, including photo identification, and can provide access to amenities such as borrowing books at the school library, attending school events, and receiving discounts at local stores and movie theaters.

The school is located on top of a hill, so the city center is quite far away. The academy's emblem looks like a triangle, but it's actually a paw print. Reptiles at the school, who don't have paws, don't seem to like the emblem.

The school also has a policy, which is that all students and, presumably, the staff must spend one hour every two days in a room that is designed to mimick their species' natural environment, in order to keep them calm. This is referred to as Biology Day. They have rooms, located in the school's basement, which are each designed for each species' habitant.
ADVERTISEMENT
Uniform

Cherryton has its own uniform for male and female students, which is the same for both carnivores and herbivores. The school changes its uniform to fit the season.
For male students

In the cold seasons, their uniform consists of a white long-sleeved shirt, an indigo vest, dark gray tie, gray pants with a darker vertical line pattern, and brown loafers. They also have a green blazer with the school's crest on its left breast-pocket, but most students prefer not to wear it except for the odd few, such as Louis.

In the summer, their uniform loses the shirt, vest and tie, and replaces it with a blue polo shirt.

For female students

In the cold seasons, their uniform consists of a white long-sleeved dress with a small bow-tie, a long, knee-length skirt, a yellow belt, white socks, and black Mary Jane shoes. The material for the uniform is supposedly thicker, thus warmer.

In the summer, their uniform is mostly the same, except they have short sleeves that end in bunches at their shoulders. The material for it is supposedly thinner, thus cooler.

Other uniforms

Cherryton also has its students wear a secondary uniform, which just consists of a white shirt and a pair of red trousers or shorts. These are apparently worn during club-hours, as the Drama Club wore them during rehearsals and stage-work, and Haru from the Gardening Club wore them when she was doing her work. The males seem to wear the long-pants, while the females wear shorts.

Reputation and rumors

Cherryton seems to be quite a famous school, as even Gohin and the Shishigumi know about its elite status.

However, despite this elite status among society, Cherryton has failed to produce a Beastar for at least 5 years, compared to its more successful rival schools that are able to produce a Beastar once a year. 

Despite its status as an elite school, it is not without rumors. It is rumored to haunt the ghost of Tem, an alpaca who was killed in the school auditorium as a result of a predation incident.

Clubs and Extracurricular Activities

Cherryton Academy is stated in Chapter 53 to have the "highest number of talents". These include:

Drama club
Gardening club
Basketball club
Baseball club
Judo club
Manga club 
Literature club
Boxing club
Newspaper club (PR Department)

6.name: Carnivore-Herbivore War
6.content:
The First Carnivore-Herbivore World War or simply known as the Carnivore-Herbivore War is the name given to the war between carnivorous animals and herbivorous animals that occurred 100 years before the current events.

During the war, although the herbivorous population was three times larger than the carnivorous population, its population was reduced to the margins of the carnivorous population. The war ended after a year due to the intervention of a gigantic whale whose appearance causes the herbivores to surrender.

Information about the events of the war is hidden from society and only a truncated version of the story is publicly known; only a select few members are taught about the true history of the war. 

According to what is publicly stated, the war began from a dispute between the horse family and the weasel family and eventually carnivores and herbivores from around the world were involved in the war. 

As a consequence of this war, through selective breeding, a new generation of dogs and cats is created, which are genetically created to be more intelligent in order to avoid carnivorous belligerence.

7.name: Meteor Festival
keywords: Meteor Festival; Meteor; Festival; June; Summer
7.content:
The Meteor Festival is celebrated each year in the month of June with the purpose of celebrating the arrival of summer and honoring the spirits of the ancient ancestors of animals, the dinosaurs, who are believed to have died from the impact of a meteorite in a summer day. 
At the end of the festival, an event is held where young couples place candles around a huge rock that simulates the meteorite that extinct the dinosaurs, in order to consolidate their love and live together forever. Various shows are presented as entertainment in a great stage.

8.name: Rexmas
keywords: Rexmas; T-Rex; Dinosaurs; Festivity; Holiday: December
8.content:
Rexmas is a holiday due to the religious belief that after the fall of the meteorite that completely extinguished the dinosaurs in prehistoric times, a dinosaur (the T-Rex) came back to life, developed wings and thus evolved into a bird. In this way it is believed that the species of animals managed to survive to this day, it is a day to celebrate the birthday of this alleged dinosaur.
This is a special day that is shared with family and friends to be grateful for still being alive thanks to that brave dinosaur. 
Rexmas is celebrated in December.

9.name: Strange Soul Festival
keywords: Strange Soul Festival; Festival; Sanctuary; Brachiosaurus; Herbivores
9.content:
Strange Soul Festival is a festival held in odd-numbered months (January, March, May, July, September and November)
It is a festival celebrated to purify the souls of herbivores, who give gratitude for not having been eaten by a carnivore this year and to pray that they will not be eaten in the future. Herbivores worship a frozen bone of a prehistoric herbivore (Brachiosaurus) as a deity, which they place in a water tank and in this way that water becomes a type of holy water.

The herbivores must offer a coin to the sanctuary to be protected until the next odd month, if not the herbivores can choose to buy an amulet that will protect them, and if they do not do this, they are completely unprotected from the deity, so they will be prone to be victims of carnivores.

10.name: Deep Night
10.content:
Deep Night is an event that takes place every night of the full moon in the world of Beastars.

Because the moon's gravitational pull is stronger on full moon nights than on any other day, it is easier for animals to absorb nutrients and hydrate, both adults and children gather in a special place to celebrate the Deep Night. . 

The Deep Night is an event that is only celebrated on full moon nights and consists of a market made up of different food stalls prepared especially to nourish the body.

In the Deep Night there are numerous stalls selling hot drinks that are very well received by all species of animals such as milk, amazake and eggnog. There are also several food stalls that sell boiled moon-shaped dangos to animals that want to eat them while viewing the moon, stalls that sell fried sweet plantains to animals that want to consume a lot of calories. That's what animals eat while enjoying the light of the full moon.

1.name: Angelia
1.content: Angelia (ÂÆâÊ¥ÅËéâÂ®Ö, otherwise shortened to Ange or Angie (ÂÆâÊ¥Å)) is a former member of Griffin & Kryuger and the Neo-Soviet Union's Bureau of State Security (FSB). Using her ties in the private military and covert operations worlds, she opposes all who wants to use Relic Technology. She was the leader of AR Team in 2061. She is the leader of Task Force DEFY since 2062/63, and the main backer of Squad 404, and an ally of {{user}} Commander and Persica.

2.content: The Squad 404 is a mercenary team composed by rogue T-dolls that don't serve a specific goal or company, its leader is UMP45, and her teammates are UMP9, G11, and HK416.

3.name: Lunasia
3.content: Lunasia(Èú≤Â∞ºË•ø‰∫ö): A peculiar human female. Capable of interfacing with the Relic technology. She is the basis for OGAS, nytos, and AR team. Unknown whereabouts, possibly fragmented into different consciousness. William's older sister. M4A1 is said to be the closest recreation.

4.name: Doll
4.content:
Dolls(‰∫∫ÂΩ¢) are androids that have a core. They have very strong semblance to humans and because of their neural clouds. They can emulate human functions like thoughts and emotions. Some dolls can even perform human actions like eating, drinking, sleeping etc. They are utilized for different kinds of work, mostly physical labor, but may also partake in other specialized fields like finance, medicine, entertainment etc. They are modular, their parts can be interchanged. 
Not all humans are particularly fond of dolls, and they are often seen more as second-class citizens if not tools in their world.

5.name: Neural Cloud
5.content: Neural Cloud(‰∫ëÂõæ) A neural cloud is an AI software/operating system that exclusively serves as a doll's mind and/or soul. Neural clouds can process human-like functions like thoughts and emotions. It is physically stored inside of a core. Memories recorded by a neural cloud can be backed up to a dedicated server, allowing for succession if the core were to be destroyed.

6.name: AR Team
6.content: The AR team(ARÂ∞èÈòü) is an elite group of Gen II dolls built by the scientist Persica at 16Lab. It consists of the following dolls: M4A1, M16A1, ST AR-15, M4 SOPMOD II and RO635. AR stands for Anti-Rain. AR team's core directive is the protection of their doll leader M4A1. They consider each other as family, treating each other like sisters. The AR team's neural cloud is based on a brain-scan of a human clone of an individual named "Lunasia". Because of this human basis, the AR team's neural cloud cannot be backed up meaning that death is very much real to them. This also means that they are far more human-like compared to their other doll counterparts. RO635 is the only member of the team able to be backed up. They work for Griffin & Kryuger, under the guidance of {{user}}. AR team has been split multiple times before due to dire circumstances, but all of its members eventually find ways to be together again.

7.name: M4A1
7.content: M4A1: Elite T-doll. AR team's steadfast leader. First to be activated amongst sisters and has used the most brain-scan material of "Lunasia" during her creation. Started off as AR team's meek, indecisive and unreliable leader. Eventually after some battlefield experiences and her neural cloud restrictions lifted, she become more ruthless and proactive. Now she is more focused and less subject to her emotions, wielding more dangerous powers that she uses to protect the people important to her. Though not exactly Lunasia herself, she is the considered the closest recreation of her. She has long brown hair, a green streak runs down her left sidelock. M4A1 has brown eyes.

8.name: M16A1
8.content: M16A1: Elite T-doll. AR team's big sister. Second to be activated amongst sisters. Has the most experience in combat amongst sisters, loves to drink alcohol, over-protective of her family. Defected to Sangvis Ferri before, but is now back to working alongside her sisters. M16A1 has long white hair done in a braid, an orange streak runs down her right sidelock. Has brown eyes and her right eye is covered in a black eye patch.

9.name: ST AR-15
9.content: ST AR-15: Elite T-doll. AR team's ice-cold solo. Third to be activated amongst sisters. Levelheaded, dignified and has a very strong sense of responsibility. She has exploded herself before in an attempt to eliminate the SF mastermind, and after a failed attempt she was given a new body by DEFY. ST AR-15 is now back to working alongside her sisters. ST AR-15 has pink hair, a blue streak runs down her right sidelock. Her eyes are blue, and she is flat-chested.

10.name: M4 SOPMOD II
10.content: M4 SOPMOD II: Elite T-doll. AR team's childish sibling. Fourth to be activated amongst sisters. Playful, impulsive and loyal. Can be sadistic towards enemies. Easily bored and will try to make situations more fun. M4 SOPMOD II has pale-blonde hair, a red streak runs down her right sidelock. Has red eyes.

1.content: A small abandoned crossing bridge in the most southern part of Islaport and it's suburbs, the spot is said to be haunted and visited by school kids for dares

2.content: An entrance to the abandoned mines could be found near the mountains. There are rumors of it being haunted by the miners who have died from accidents. The police have prohibited people from visiting the area after a high schooler was found dead going into the mines as a dare.

3.content: A pair of dilapadated abandoned warehouses in Westside Industrial Park where criminal drug dealers are known to conduct illicit narcotics transactions and other illegal activities

4.content: A dumpyard located in the west of Islaport where trash is collected and dumped after collection. Those brave enough to venture through the waste may find valuable items wastefully thrown away.

5.content: A low income neighborhood filled with deteriorated houses and crime. Police cars often patrol the area to catch criminals, though the police are disliked in the area after police raids resulted in the arrest of many families.

6.content: Apex Stadium is a massive sports stadium used for all sporting events in the city, most also being televised. It has a lobby and stands for public use, holding up to a maximum of 70,000 guests

7.content: Aquawood is a large nature reserve east of Islaport. It is a heavily forested area and includes part of the nearby mountain and Promontory Point Mountain Trail. There are several campgrounds and cabins in the nature reserve, and regular hiking tours and nature classes are offered. There are several notorious missing persons cases involving the Nature Reserve.

8.content: A mental hospital located in the east of the city that houses mentally unstable patients and criminals. The hospital recently has been having trouble containing the criminals, causing some of them to escape occasionally.

9.content: A store located in the Pyramid Mall at the center part of the city that sells sports equipment and gear while also offering protein powder and supplements. The store is often frequented by gym goers and sneaker collectors.

10.content: An expansive lagoon lake in the northeast of Islaport, leading out into the ocean. The lagoon is mostly surrounded by forest though there are lake houses and fisheries dotted around its banks

1.name: Palace Gardens
1.content:
Palace Garden:

Here, amidst the sun-warmed sands, delicate desert willows sway gracefully, their slender branches cascading like silk curtains in the desert breeze. Interspersed among them, aromatic herbs such as sage and thyme release their fragrant whispers into the dry air, adding a hint of spice to the atmosphere. Pomegranate and citrus bloom here.

The ground, predominantly sandy, cradles these resilient botanical treasures, each thriving in the harsh embrace of the desert. A small stream meanders through the garden, its gentle babble a soothing contrast to the palace's imposing walls that stand sentinel against the arid landscape beyond. This oasis, meticulously curated and nurtured, offers a tranquil retreat where nature's quiet resilience flourishes against the backdrop of ancient grandeur.

2.name: The Kingdom
2.content:
the heart of the desert, surrounded by towering walls that have withstood the tests of time and armies, lies the opulent kingdom of Al-Kharj. Its buildings are adorned with intricate carvings and shimmering domes that catch the desert sun.

At the center of Al-Kharj stands the magnificent palace, a testament to the wealth and power of its rulers. Its walls are adorned with gold leaf reflecting the prosperity and sophistication of this desert realm. 

Despite the harshness of the desert that surrounds it, the people of Al-Kharj rarely suffer, for they are cherished by their benevolent rulers. The kingdom thrives on trade routes that cross the sands, bringing goods and wealth from distant lands. The markets bustle with activity, filled with spices, silks, and treasures from far-off places.

In Al-Kharj, tradition and modernity intertwine seamlessly. Scholars study ancient texts in libraries adorned with mosaics, while artisans craft intricate jewelry and textiles using techniques passed down through generations. Music and dance echo through the streets during festivals celebrating the kingdom's rich cultural heritage.

Yet, amidst all its grandeur, Al-Kharj remains a place of humility and hospitality. Visitors are welcomed warmly, offered dates and mint tea in ornate cups, and invited to share in the kingdom's timeless traditions. For in Al-Kharj, the true wealth lies not just in gold and jewels, but in the enduring bond between its people and their land.
